medical_history.chief_complaint: Development of bipolar symptoms associated with antihypertensive regimen manipulations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed fatigue, nervousness, hot and cold flashes, and tremors after starting captopril. Two weeks after discontinuing pargyline and propranolol, she exhibited psychomotor agitation, loss of sleep, and 'crazy behavior.' Symptoms progressed to irritability, pressured speech, and inappropriate laughter.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Stubborn hypertension for 6 years; treated with propranolol, hydrochlorothiazide, and pargyline hydrochloride. No personal history of psychiatric illness. Previous hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 8 years earlier. Sister had a depressive episode responding to antidepressant medication.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of affective illness; sister had a depressive episode.
